page.title: 01THE AREA.
page.content: It is on the N.W.edge of Sheffield.It has the outer suburbs called Loxley, Stannington in the east,in the west it is rural with villages.Two river vallies disect the area from west to east,the Rivelin and Loxley.Little is left of the original natural enviroment.The landscape has been altered by man,in the rural areas with fields for farming and in the urban areas by buildings.The buildings are mainly houses except for a few remaining industries in the vallies. Stannington village is now part of Sheffield due to 1960's new housing. The industries located here to use the water power and local raw materials, i.e.T.Wragg who make refactory bricks for the steel industry.They used to mine for the local clay.Myers Grove School is on the eastern edge of the area.
